title: Bay of Biscay
summary: The Bay of Biscay (/ˈbɪskeɪ, -ki/; French: Golfe de Gascogne, Spanish: Golfo de Vizcaya, Basque: Bizkaiko Golkoa, Occitan: Golf de Gasconha, Breton: Pleg-mor Gwaskogn) is a gulf of the northeast Atlantic Ocean located south of the Celtic Sea. It lies along the western coast of France from Point Penmarc'h to the Spanish border, and the northern coast of Spain west to Cape Ortegal.
